semantic_title: Use of Codes for Reporting Purposes: Only Complete Codes Are Permissible
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 3. Use of codes for reporting purposes

content.full_text: For reporting purposes only codes are permissible, not categories or subcategories, and any applicable 7th character is required. (Evidence: pg no: 8, L24-L26)
content.summary: Establishes that only complete codes with all required characters can be used for reporting, not categories or subcategories (Evidence: pg no: 8, L24-L26)
key_concepts: Only codes are permissible for reporting (Evidence: pg no: 8, L25)
Categories and subcategories cannot be used for reporting (Evidence: pg no: 8, L25)
7th characters are required when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 8, L25-L26)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For reporting purposes only codes are permissible, not categories or subcategories (Evidence: pg no: 8, L24-L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: Complete codes at the highest level of specificity must be used for all reporting purposes (Evidence: pg no: 8, L24-L25)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Any applicable 7th character is required (Evidence: pg no: 8, L25-L26)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a code has an applicable 7th character, it must be included for the code to be valid for reporting (Evidence: pg no: 8, L25-L26)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Locate the most specific code available
Step 2: Verify it is a complete code, not a category or subcategory
Step 3: Check if 7th character is applicable
Step 4: Add required 7th character if applicable
Step 5: Use complete code for reporting
